intro: Catesbaea fuertesii, commonly known as the red mombin, is a tropical tree native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and large, glossy green leaves that are alternate and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange to red, fleshy fruits resembling small tomatoes. These fruits are edible and contain a single large seed, making the plant both ornamental and useful in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
